commits.message: Bug 1414879 - Avoid privacy notice on every launch (#473)

Fix typo in message about 64-bit systems (#472)

Right now the message about default build type (64-bit vs. 32-bit) incorrectly refers to them as "64 bits" and "32 bits".  The correct/common adjective for these types of builds are "64-bit" vs. "32-bit" (singular bits, and with a hyphen).  See e.g. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/switch-32-bit-64-bit as one reference on this language.

drop stray space before question mark

If you use mozregression with a "good" date that's newer than the "bad" date, it asks you:
> Maybe you wanted to use the --find-fix flag ?

Note the awkward space character at the end of the sentence there, before the question mark.  This pull request just drops that stray space.

were for an automation-type environment.

Fix bisect progress type mismatch, convert dates to datetimes

Since it is unsupported to get the delta of a date and a datetime,
use only datetimes.

Bug: https://github.com/mozilla/mozregression/pull/435
Allow longer line lengths
Review updates

Bug 1304213 - Improve integration branch detection

This updates the merge handling logic to choose the proper integration
branch when there is no merge commit message. Each integration branch is
queried for the changeset in question and the one containing it with the
earliest push date is chosen.
Add autoland to integration branches

Update config and build info handling

Taskcluster routes (for linux64 debug at least) have temporarily changed
from using 'debug' to 'dbg'. Eventually this behavior will revert but
for now we need to special case it.

Additionally the binary archive name for builds in taskcluster has
changed from specifying the platform and architecture to just using a
generic term, 'target', for all platforms. The build regex has been
updated to handle that behavior.

Allow for a bisection without a download manager

This allows a bisection to take place without using a download manager.
This is particularly useful bisecting builds where the data we're
interested in is already in test logs, so no binary is necessary.

Bug 1245506 - [gui] invisible items in infos panel

Fixes the bug where the right click items where invisible in the infos panel.

Bug 1245332 - stopping firefox may hang on windows

On windows, if a firefox build is stopped after it had restarted (from
Menu (≡) -> [?] -> Restart with Add-ons Disabled for example) it will
hang for a couple of minutes.

The blocking comes from mozprocess, but it is quite hard to fix properly,
and it is a corner case - so here is a workaround patch.

It run the stop method in a thread, and wait 0.7 seconds for its
completion. If the thread is not terminated after that, we simply forget
it, so it will be finished later (abruptly in case the program ends
before the completion).

Bug 1245335 - use android-api-15 for recent fennec builds

For both archives.m.o and taskcluster, fennec route names have changed since
around 2016-01-29 - and mozregression can't find recent builds because
of that.

This patch should solve the issue by using api-15 instead of api-11
after this date.

Bug 1245333 - [gui] wrong build for retry

We calculate the middle of the build range to know which build should be
run.
In case a retry is done after a skip, this lead to an error - so for the
retry action we should not calculate the middle again, just reuse the
previous one.

I took the opportunity to clean the mid/self.mid redundancy in the code.

[GUI] - fix labels in wizard

Use Label: [FIELD] form everywhere.

Bug 1246339 - [GUI] bring back the date input

After looking more, calendar are not quite a good choice. So this bring
back the date line edit, and still allow choosing using a calendar with
a little arrow on the right of the line edit.

[GUI] Automatically bisect integration branch on merge

Automatically bisect integration branch on merge

This change the workflow of mozregression (non GUI for now).

Basically, when we finish a nightly bisection, we switch to taskcluster
bisection to reduce the range on the same branch.

Once this is reduced to two push (that is one good, one bad), we parse
the log message and try to detect a merge. If we find a merge, we
continue the bisection on the branch where the merged commits comes from.

I just noted something on the PR, you forgot to handle the --pref argument.
Also, the pref object needs do be added here (in launcher_kwargs): https://github.com/mozilla/mozregression/pull/190/files#diff-9ca866adb100de14c577141d9b0d6b67R245, else it does not have any effect.

You have to add the created prefs object like this:

launcher_kwargs = dict(
addons=options.addons,
profile=options.profile,
cmdargs=options.cmdargs,
preferences=prefs,
)

This is because the variable launcher_kwargs will then be passed here : https://github.com/mozilla/mozregression/blob/master/mozregression/test_runner.py#L29, then we will use it here: https://github.com/mozilla/mozregression/blob/master/mozregression/test_runner.py#L131 and finally it will override the default that you just added here: https://github.com/mozilla/mozregression/pull/190/files#diff-9be3d66461b771098aa1bcc305505480R113

This is how your prefs object will end up in the launchers.MozRunnerLauncher._start method.

Tell me if it is not clear, I think it is pretty important to understand this.

This way if the lower bound is not needed for example, the higher may use the full range.
If we have a self.window_range of 4 (the default) and range_min is empty, range_max would have contained only at max 4 items to be fetched instead of 8 - I wanted to optimize the number downloaded here if one or the other of the limit were not required.

Maybe it is confusing because of the name: self.window_range is actually in all this patch half the range.
In fact the else with the return is needed, because we are in while True loop. I may rewrite it with a variable like go_on = True and do a while go_on if you prefer.

Why SystemError ? I understand Error (ConfigParser.Error), but not SystemError here.

I think it could be useful to exit here if the file is not well formed.

I suspect that the use of tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() is the cause of the error on windows, because the file is open in read and write mode. After writing, you may have to to a seek(0) to rewind the file.
I suggest that you use instead:
  conf = tempfile.mkstemp()
  self.addCleanup(os.unlink, conf) # ensure file will be deleted
  with open(conf, 'w') as f:
      f.write(...) # write the conf
  # now, execute the test on conf

Could you rewrite this with self.assertRaise() instead ? I find it much more readable:
with self.assertRaises(SystemExit):
   main.get_defaults()
could you rewrite this as handle, conf = tempfile.mkstemp() ?
same here: handle, conf = tempfile.mkstemp()

Well, prefs is our object that contain preferences. You added preferences from the --preferences file, but not from the --pref argument. Also, could you create a function that will return the prefs object ? It will be easier to test. Last thing, could you make the --preferences a list (like for --pref) by adding nargs='*' ? I changed my mind on this after looking at the behaviour of mozprofile.

Yep, that's right :) The idea is to be able to pass the arguments in the same way as in mozprofile, create a preferences object (and fill it accordingly to the passe arguments) then give that object to our launcher.
You missed the preferences here.

if you don't do that, a user that only use "mozregression --good-rev 123" for example will default to nightly bisection instead of inbound which is not really user-friendly.

call() require you to list the arguments one by one - that is:
call('cd', 'mozregui')
but you can put them in a list and then use \* (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3394835/args-and-kwargs)
args = ['cd', 'mozregui']
call(*args)

with tarfile.open('mozregression-gui.tar.gz', 'w:gz') as release_tar:

issue_comments.body: Great addition!

Thanks! I'll take a look at this. Just FYI Github stuff:

for other projects, it's better to do this kind of work in a remote branch that isn't master, in case the upstream doesn't take your changes and your master becomes dirty.

Also, you don't need to make a new pull request if you want to add another commit, a pull request will pick up any new commits to the branch you made the pull request from.

issue_comments.body:
So I think you need to close this pull request before I can make another.

I've included your updates above in my forked repo and also added the changes to re-fix Issue #33.

Also, I left in the self.binary under FennecNightly as a comment because I wasn't sure if this uses a different binary location. I can remove it if you'd like. `mozregression --app=fennec` doesn't seem to work on my system.

Let me know if I need to do anything else.
Mac apparently is relying on this code: https://github.com/mozilla/mozbase/blob/master/mozrunner/mozrunner/runner.py#L89
@k0s Thanks for the feedback. I'll make the changes and re-send the pull request.

> instead of the parseBits function

I used the function because we have the extra bit of logic for not allowing 64 bit to be specified on a 32 bit system here:

https://github.com/mozilla/mozregression/pull/54/files#L1R273

Although I think it would be simpler to have written the function like so:

```
def parseBits(optionBits):
    """returns the correctly typed bits"""
    if optionBits == "32":
        return 32
    else:
        # if 64 bits is passed on a 32 bit system, it won't be honored
        return mozinfo.bits
```

Yeah. I can get this fixed up this week.

Sam
